item.title: The ratio of Dye2 to Dye1 at each spine shows the proportion of new vs. old AMPA receptors. Doyeon mapped these ratios in hippocampal CA1 pyramidal cells in mice exposed to contextual fear-conditioning (CFC) and to context-only controls. The CFC-treated mice had more plasticity. https://t.co/vzKT2pVaGd
item.description: The ratio of Dye2 to Dye1 at each spine shows the proportion of new vs. old AMPA receptors. item.title: Doyeon also measured cFos in each cell. In the CFC-treated mice, there was a strong correlation between the cFos level and the amount of AMPAR exocytosis. https://t.co/3N1qsAy6tJ

item.title: “Engram” neurons defined by high cFos are also neurons with high synaptic plasticity! This provides a mechanism for how engram cells can encode a memory.
item.description: “Engram” neurons defined by high cFos are also neurons with high synaptic plasticity! This provides a mechanism for how engram cells can encode a memory.
item.content:encoded: “Engram” neurons defined by high cFos are also neurons with high synaptic plasticity! This provides a mechanism for how engram cells can encode a memory.

item.title: Doyeon also did a careful analysis of the subcellular distribution of potentiated spines. Most of the plasticity was in proximal basal and apical dendrites. https://t.co/sEr2PIKOzf
item.description: Doyeon also did a careful analysis of the subcellular distribution of potentiated spines. Most of the plasticity was in proximal basal and apical dendrites. https://t.co/sEr2PIKOzf

item.title: There are also analyses of 'hot' vs 'cold' dendrites, and sub-dendrite clustering of synaptic plasticity. We think that pulse-chase labeling with HT-GluA1 is a powerful tool for mapping synaptic plasticity.
item.description: There are also analyses of 'hot' vs 'cold' dendrites, and sub-dendrite clustering of synaptic plasticity. We think that pulse-chase labeling with HT-GluA1 is a powerful tool for mapping synaptic plasticity.

item.title: This is consistent with the view that distal apical inputs from entorhinal cortex act as a gate on plasticity of proximal inputs from CA3.
item.description: This is consistent with the view that distal apical inputs from entorhinal cortex act as a gate on plasticity of proximal inputs from CA3.

item.title:
We know from the golden ratio formula that 1 + √5 = 2ϕ and from the famous Euler's identity, that eⁱⁿ + 1 = 0.
Since 1 = 2ϕ - √5, we can also write that eⁱⁿ + 2ϕ - √5 = 0 or eⁱⁿ + 2ϕ = √5
A simple expression relating ϕ, π, i, and e
[source: https://t.co/5gN5TKM5XM] https://t.co/ytNIRFWY87

item.title:
Only additional worry I had is that ecDNA could be used to "store" resistance.
e.g. Drug A targets Gene A, but if Gene A is placed on ecDNA, it may survive elimination. Then when Drug B targets Gene B, Gene A could be reactivated from ecDNA for its beneficial use.
